subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 25, 2007

TOP STORIESRosie's Gone From "The View" 
Rosie O'Donnell and Elisabeth Hasselbeck have had their last heated argument on "The View." ABC says O'Donnell is taking an
                        early leave; her contract was up on June 22. More...
• Americans Head For The Hills, And More
                     					| Watch• U.S. Military Aid Reaches Lebanese Army
                     					| Watch• Democrats: Drive To End War Isn't Over
                     					| WatchU.S.Americans Head For The Hills, And More
Gas and lodging prices are up, airfares are down, and while Americans may make some adjustments in their plans, they're still
                        traveling millions of miles over the Memorial Day weekend. More...Watch: Summer Travel Begins
• United Jet Makes Emergency Landing• Ex-NHL Star Pleads Guilty In Gambling Case• Teen Charged With Hate Crime Over Haircut• More StoriesWorldU.S. Military Aid Reaches Lebanese Army
U.S. military aid has been rushed into Lebanon, to help the army in its fight against an Islamic militant group holed up in
                        a Palestinian refugee camp. Sporadic gunfire is still taking place near the camp's entrance, keeping the situation tense.
                         More...Watch: Lebanon Cease-Fire Collapses
• Al-Sadr Reappears In Iraq At Rally
                     					| Watch• Suspect Eyed In Missing British Girl Case
                     					| Watch• Tensions Rise In Ukraine • More StoriesPoliticsDemocrats: Drive To End War Isn't Over
Despite a bruising loss in their bid to tie funding for the Iraq war to a deadline for U.S. troop withdrawals, Democrats insist
                        their drive to end the war has just begun. President Bush will sign the Iraq spending bill later today. More...Watch: Bush Embraces Benchmarks
• 2008 Primary Shuffle Causes Uproar• CBS Poll: Most Support Immigration Reform• Fred Thompson Fuels Speculation In Ct.• More StoriesHealthStudy: Too Much TV Worsens Kids' Diabetes
Diabetic children who spent a lot of time glued to the TV had a tougher time controlling their blood sugar, according to a
                        Norwegian study that illustrates yet another downside of too much television. More...Watch: Dr. Senay On Avandia    
• Calm Urged For Avandia Patients• When Health Coverage Doesn't Hold Up
                     					| Watch• Tooth Whiteners: Something For Everyone
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechWhale Rescuers Try New Tactic: Fire Hoses
Unfazed by the sounds of other whales and clanging pipes, two wayward humpback whales will next encounter the spray of fire
                        hoses, which scientists hope will herd them back toward the ocean. More...Watch: New Plan To Rescue Whales
• Reply To E-mail Overload: "Enough!"• Facebook Aspires To Be The Next Microsoft• Being Here, Working There
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessFacebook Aspires To Be The Next Microsoft
Facebook Inc. is encouraging other companies to sell products and create software for use on the popular social networking
                        site, hoping to expand into a universal destination on the Web.
                         More...
• Coke To Buy Water Maker For $4.1B• Minimum Wage Hike Approved• Can Your Finances Survive A Hurricane?• More StoriesEntertainmentProsecutors: No Charges In O'Neal Brawl
Los Angeles prosecutors say actor Ryan O'Neal won't face charges for firing a gun during a dust-up with his eldest son earlier
                        this year. More...Watch: O'Neal Family Feud
• This Week: Winners & Losers
                     					| Watch• "Grey's" Star Urges Tolerance In TV Spot• "Jericho" Fans Go Nuts• More StoriesOpinionGo Easy On McCain
John McCain's recent remark about Mitt Romney has been portrayed in the media as a sign that the Arizona senator's temper
                        is out of control. But The New Republic asks it be seen for what it was: a pretty good joke.  More...Watch: McCain On Iraq & Campaign '08
• What Does "Reagan Republican" Mean In '07?• CBS Poll: Most Support Immigration Reform• Barry Bonds: Cheater• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Celeb Spot: Depp: Tough To Say "So Long" To Capt. Jack
He says he's "emotional" over the likely end of his run as the character in the "Pirates" series. Depp also reflects on his
                        huge popularity, and tells how Keith Richards reacted to Capt. Jack having been based on him, on The Early Show. More...Watch: Depp On Captain Jack

On The Road Despite Gas PricesTravelers should be ready to pay record-breaking gas prices over the Memorial Day weekend. But the soaring prices don't appear
                                    to be keeping Americans off the roads. Tracie Strahan reports.
